caption: Alma Mahler in 1909
spouse__caption: Walter Gropius . Photo by Louis Held
spouse__wordnet_type__gloss: (someone who creates plans to be used in making something (such as buildings))
spouse__hypernym__competencies: Engineering, technical knowledge, building design, planning and management skills
spouse__significantBuilding__rector: Prof. Dr. Alaa Abdul Hussein Abdul Rasool
spouse__significantBuilding__motto: وقل رب زدني علما English Translation: Say "O my Lord, Advance me in knowledge."
spouse__significantBuilding__imagecaptio: The Bauhaus building in Dessau was designed by Walter Gropius. It was the longest-serving of the three Bauhaus locations .
spouse__significantBuilding__text: As to my practice, when I built my first house in the U.S.A.—which was my own—I made it a point to absorb into my own conception those features of the New England architectural tradition that I found still alive and adequate. This fusion of the regional spirit with a contemporary approach to design produced a house that I would never have built in Europe with its entirely different climatic, technical and psychological background.
spouse__significantBuilding__architect: Emery Roth & Sons, Pietro Belluschi, and Walter Gropius
spouse__award__awardedFor: Achievement worthy of honour in memory of Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
child__restingPlace__caption: The BAPS Shri Swaminarayan Mandir London is the second-largest Hindu temple in England and Europe.
Wembley Stadium, home of the England men and women's football team and the FA Cup Final, has a seating capacity of 90,000. It is the UK's biggest stadium.
Centre Court at Wimbledon. Held every June and July, Wimbledon is the oldest tennis tournament in the world, and the only major played on grass.
British volunteer recruits in London, August 1914, during World War I
Twickenham, home of the England national rugby union team, has a capacity of 82,000 seats.
St Paul's Cathedral, the seat of the Bishop of London
A bombed-out London street during the Blitz, World War II
child__restingPlace__imageCaption: Clockwise from top: City of London in the foreground with Canary Wharf in the far background; Trafalgar Square; London Eye; Tower Bridge; and a London Underground roundel in front of Elizabeth Tower
child__restingPlace__header: Maps of Greater London showing percentage distribution of selected ethnic groups according to the 2011 Census
